metadata.title: CVE-2015-0293 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The SSLv2 implementation in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zf, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0r,1.0.1 before 1.0.1m, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2a allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (s2_lib.c assertion failure and daemon exit) viaa crafted CLIENT-MASTER-KEY message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu11').
